title: Calories in a Guinness Pint
meta_description: Discover calories in a Guinness pint, including carbs, protein, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard Guinness Draught, 4.2% ABV, 568 ml UK pint serving, poured from tap or can, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, serving size, and pouring method. Check labels or brewery info when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard pint of Guinness contains about 210 calories, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Guinness Foreign Extra Stout (7.5% ABV, higher strength)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pint of Guinness?
faqs.a: Approximately 210 kcal for a standard 568 ml pint.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a Guinness pint?
faqs.a: About 18.3 g of carbohydrates, primarily from malt.

faqs.q: Does Guinness have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Roughly 1.7 g protein and 0 g fat per pint.

faqs.q: How does Guinness compare to other beers calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar to many stouts; lighter lagers may have 150-180 kcal per pint.

faqs.q: Does the ABV affect calories in Guinness?
faqs.a: Yes, higher ABV versions like Foreign Extra add about 60 kcal per pint.
